Content.Text:
You can collect milk from
adult cows using a
milker.

You can collect Jersey
milk from adult Jersey
cows using a milker.

You can collect wool
from adult sheep using
clippers.

You can collect Suffolk
wool from adult Suffolk
sheep using clippers.

Adult chickens can lay
eggs. (Eggs put into an
incubator will hatch into
chicks after a few days.)

Adult silkie chickens can
lay silkie eggs. (Eggs put
in incubator hatch into
chicks after a few days.)

You can collect alpaca
wool from adult alpacas
using clippers.

You can collect brown
alpaca wool from adult
brown alpacas using
clippers.

You can collect yak milk
from adult yaks using a
milker.

You can collect llama wool
from adult llamas using
clippers.

Ride on it to get around
more quickly. (Lives in
the barn.)

Dog with pointed ears that
stick up. The higher the
affection, the more it
helps grazing livestock.

Dog with droopy ears. The
higher the affection, the
more it will help with
grazing of your livestock.

Shorthaired cat. The
higher its affection, the
more it will help with
grazing of your livestock.

Longhaired cat. The
higher its affection, the
more it will help with
grazing of your livestock.
